snippet: The Obama administration fears that reopening the issues with Iran in the last stages of the talks would invite it to do the same, rapidly unraveling the deal.
abstract: Yuval Steinitz, Israel's minister of intelligence and strategic affairs, presents list of specific requirements that would make final agreement on Iran's nuclear program acceptable to Israel; move is marked change from country's previous position that only good deal would be to completely ban uranium enrichment in Iran.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration fears that reopening the issues with Iran in the last stages of the talks would invite it to do the same, rapidly unraveling the deal.

headline.main: Skeptical of Iran Nuclear Deal, Israel Calls for Changes
headline.print_headline: Skeptical of Iran Nuclear Deal, Israel Calls for Changes

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
